page.title: 17THE L.S.A.NEWBOURNE CONT'D.
page.content: At the end of six months, successful trainees with their wives and families were sent to their respective holdings. Those with a flair for open horticulture,pigs and poultry were sent to larger holdings 8 to 10 acres.Others were allocated to 5 acre medium holdings with part glass. The smallest holdings of 3 acres, many on the best land, were reserved for those who wished to specialise in glass, mainly growing tomatoes and lettuces. In the first few years there were frequent failures and disappointments and many of the original trainees left. At the outbreak of war in 1939 all grants towards settling unemployed men on the land ceased, instead the L.S.A. accepted tenants with agricultural experience and a limited amount of capital.
